basics.name: Ahmed Abdelrahman
basics.label: Roboticist
basics.summary: A robotics engineer with a background in mechatronic engineering and experience in research, software development, and system integration.

work.name: Munich Institute of Robotics and Machine Intelligence (MIRMI), Technical University of Munich (TUM)
work.summary: Conducting research on neuromorphic computing for neurorobotic control on robot manipulators and upper-limb prostheses. Also contributing to various research projects, including work on computer vision and motion optimality.

work.name: German Center for Neurodegenerative Diseases (Deep-MI Group)
work.summary: Contributed to the development of FastSurfer: a deep learning-based, Dockerized brain image analysis tool, by developing and maintained Python. Developed an automated testing and validation framework for the testing pipeline.

work.name: KELO Robotics GmbH
work.summary: Developed software for reliable person and cart detection from RGB-D data for a UVC disinfection robot and a logistics robot, respectively. Designed and conducted systematic tests to evaluate robot functionalities.

work.name: Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University of Applied Sciences (H-BRS)
work.position: Research Assistant for Horizon 2020 ROPOD Project
work.summary: Contributed software required to achieve fault-tolerant operation on an autonomous mobile robot, such as for fault detection and compensation. Led extensive testing of a robots’ navigation and other functionalities.

work.name: Tareq Salem AlFazari Contracting Company
work.summary: Worked on site management and the design and installation of mechanical and electrical systems in the construction of a ministerial suite.

awards.title: VDI Förderpreis 2023 (Master's Thesis, 1st place)
awards.summary: Awarded by the association of German engineers (Verein Deutscher Ingenieure) for theses or dissertations that 'should contain outstanding achievements in terms of innovative solutions, special economic significance or social relevance.' Candidates are nominated by the deans at their home institutions.

awards.title: Bonn-Rhein-Sieg Sponsorship Award (Master's Thesis)
awards.summary: Granted by university sponsors and 'recognizes graduates who stand out for their outstanding final thesis, but also for their very good grades throughout their studies and especially for their personality'.

awards.title: AFCEA Bonn e.V. Studienpreis 2023 (Master's Thesis, 1st Place)
awards.summary: Awarded to students in recognition of an excellent bachelor's or master's thesis in the fields of applied computer science, communications engineering or automation technology. Students are enominated by their professors and the work is evaluated by an independent, multi-disciplinary AFCEA commitee.

awards.title: DAAD Matching Funds Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded at the Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University of Applied Sciences to especially gifted international students, which is partly funded by the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) and a private sponsor.

projects.name: FastSurfer
projects.description: Contributed features and automated validation framework development and maintenance
highlights: Maintained and implemented improvements in Python and Bash code base
Developed automated testing and validation framework for FastSurfer pipeline

projects.name: RoboCup@Home: Robot Software Development
projects.description: Contributed various ML-driven, robot functionalities and several custom RViz plugins to the b-it-bots team's software.
highlights: Contributed RViz plugins for more efficient map annotation, ROS action execution, and 3D object visualization

projects.name: euROBIN: General-Purpose Perception Module
projects.description: Contributed to TUM-MIRMI team's software for euROBIN competitions
highlights: Developed a general-purpose perception module for robot manipulation, which was presented at the European Robotics Forum 2025 and nominated for a best paper award
Contributed to Franka robot software stack and component integration (perception, manipulation)

projects.name: Myoelectric Control for Grasping on a Franka Robot
projects.description: Developed an implementation myoelectric robot control for object manipulation on a Franka robot for the automatica 2025 robotics fair
highlights: Integrated EMG sensors, a robotic arm, and an anthropomorphic end-effector
Created ML models that decode a user's motion intention through EMG signals
Transformed decoded user intentions to grasping commands for a robot performing object manipulation tasks
